title: Indian shares slip amid global slowdown worries; banks, metals slide

Indian shares slip amid global slowdown worries; banks, metals slide

Stock Markets 20 minutes ago (Oct 03, 2019 16:10)

© Reuters. Indian shares slip amid global slowdown worries; banks, metals slide BENGALURU, Oct 3 (Reuters) - Indian shares fell on Thursday, dragged lower by banking and metals stocks, as the United States said it would slap tariffs on European goods, fanning fears about global economic slowdown. The broader NSE index fell 0.40% to 11,314.00, while the benchmark BSE index closed 0.52% lower at 38,106.87. The Nifty private banks index fell 1%, with IndusInd Bank and HDFC Bank declining the most, while the Nifty metals index shed 2.94%. Shares in Yes Bank , however, gained 32.8%, their best one-day gain, after the lender's chief executive officer reassured markets before the opening bell that the bank remains on solid financial footing, following a bruising fall earlier this week.
